abstract: Motorola  said Carl C. Icahn filed documents seeking government permission to acquire $2 billion worth of the telecom’s stock. Motorola said Icahn and his Icahn Partners hedge fund are each asking the government for permission, under what’s known as the Hart-Scott-Rodino securities law, to buy at least $119.7 million and up to $500 million of Motorola shares. Two other funds, Icahn Partners Master Fund and Icahn Partners Master Fund II, are each asking for permission to acquire in excess of $500 million worth, but less than 25 percent of all of Motorola’s outstanding shares.
lead_paragraph: Motorola  said Carl C. Icahn filed documents seeking government permission to acquire $2 billion worth of the telecom’s stock. Motorola said Icahn and his Icahn Partners hedge fund are each asking the government for permission, under what’s known as the Hart-Scott-Rodino securities law, to buy at least $119.7 million and up to $500 million of Motorola shares. Two other funds, Icahn Partners Master Fund and Icahn Partners Master Fund II, are each asking for permission to acquire in excess of $500 million worth, but less than 25 percent of all of Motorola’s outstanding shares.

headline.main: Icahn to Buy $2 Billion of Motorola Shares
